lexUnit.name: hate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel intense dislike for or a strong aversion towards

sentence.text: He hates days when he ca n't get straight into his workshop .
She hated it when he made her feel stupid .
` I hate it when people talk about me rather than to me .
` I hate it when Heathcliff is punished !
No shoes -- I hate a man who dances barefoot " .
I really hate you when you 're like that . "
He hated what he saw at Evanston .
We hated what our mother was doing and you knew ! "
She hated how she sounded , but she could n't seem to snap out of it .
Christ , I hate when people do that !
He hated to disappoint her .
I hate to negotiate , it 's demeaning . "
I hated to worry her .
I found the school hard at first because I hated being shut in .
Now , though she hated hurting him , it had to be done .

He performed these minor tasks diligently , although he hated writing letters .

He hates me coming here .
He hates people leaving him . "
I hate seeing plates being broken .

I 'd hate you to waste your time ! " she said acidly .

I hate that , I hate boys like that .

` I just hate the thought of standing in front of a lot of people . "
He hates the thought of missing out on a big occasion .

He hated her for not having seen what he had seen .
